conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on wire ABC by considering forces on segments AB and BC separately.
Segment AB: Length = L, Current = I, Magnetic field = B (perpendicular, inward).
Force on segment AB is F_AB = I * L * B, directed upward using the right-hand rule.
Segment BC: Length = L, Current = I, Magnetic field = B (perpendicular, outward).
Force on segment BC is F_BC = I * L * B, directed downward using the right-hand rule.
Angle between force vectors is 120°; resolve forces into horizontal and vertical components.
Vertical component of F_AB is F_AB * sin(60°).
Horizontal component of F_AB is F_AB * cos(60°).
Vertical component of F_BC is F_BC * sin(60°).
Horizontal component of F_BC is -F_BC * cos(60°).
Calculate vertical components: F_vertical = 2 * I * L * B * sin(60°).
Resultant force is purely vertical: F_resultant = I * L * B * sqrt(3).
Magnitude of the Ampere force is F = I * L * B * sqrt(3).
